ygData.subject: Re: Camping
ygData.msgSnippet: Tom, I can pretty much confirm this new code ... ill give you my example. About 3 weeks ago or so i went to guk and got the chitin shell sheild, the giant
ygData.messageBody:
Tom,

I can pretty much confirm this new code ... ill give you my example.

About 3 weeks ago or so i went to guk and got the chitin shell sheild, the
giant heart spider took no time at all to spawn...just last week i had gone
to guk with a friend in my guild who also wanted a chitin shell sheild. We
waited and waited and killed spider after spider, but no giant heart spider
had spawned...i finally thought to myself that maybe it was because i had
the chitin shell sheild already equipped so after we killed the spawn i ran
off to a different room to heal up. Well when the next spider spawned it WAS
the Giant heart spider and we then got the sheild. So i say that the code
could be working in two ways.

1. No one can hang around the spot that the MOB spawns.
2. No one that has the item that the MOB drops can hang around where the MOB
spawns.

Hope this helps you figure it out.
John Zwanenburg
Tips Support/Support Sipt
Tel: (613) 998-2745

> ----------
> From: Tom Swift[SMTP:tswift@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, June 03, 1999 1:40 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Camping
>
>
> I have it on good authoriry that anti-camping code was implemented in the
> last patch and I need some help to confirm it.
>
> There is a detection zone around spawn points which EQ checks before
> spawning a creature. If the area is camped the spawn will be delayed, so
> a creature will spawn...just not as often. If the special item the NPC
> carries is present in the zone then the NPC will not spawn with it.
>
> I have been trying to get a shiny brass shield for the last 2 weeks or so.
> The trainer never seems to have...I have heard this as well from people
> who are camping the spot to twink guild mates. Oddly enough there is
> almost always a shiny shield within striking distance of the trainers
> spawn point. I have heard others on this list mention that they could not
> get a BBC no matter how long they waited....I am wondering if they had
> another BBC in the group they were camping with?
>
> This code is a good start for reducing camping. Because it was done
> quietly there is not a big "Hoopla" of campers complaining, they are
> simply not seeing anything spawn. This could also explain the rumors that
> the Tommy no longer spawns. because almost always the campers there have
> 3+ tommys in the group. It is going to be a long time before word gets
> around though so you aren't going to see some of the popularly camped
> items for awhile.
>
> Anyone who can offer information confirming or denying this rumor won't be
> rewarded. But I am sure they will earn the admiration and gratitude of
> the rest of the people on this list.....well maybe just the gratitude at
> least.
>
> Bael
> Warrior of the 16th Order
> Indigo Brotherhood
>
